pli-tv-kd16:6.2.10.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.11.eng: “Who, monks, deserves the best seat, the best water, and the best almsfood?”

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.13.pli: “yo, bhagavā, khattiyakulā pabbajito so arahati aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍan”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:6.2.13.eng: “Those who’ve gone forth from an aristocratic family deserve the best seat, water, and almsfood.”

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.15.pli: “yo, bhagavā, brāhmaṇakulā pabbajito so arahati aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍan”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:6.2.15.eng: “Those who’ve gone forth from a brahmin family deserve the best seat, water, and almsfood.”

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.17.pli: “yo, bhagavā, gahapatikulā pabbajito so arahati aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍan”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:6.2.17.eng: “Those who’ve gone forth from a householder family,

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.19.pli: “yo, bhagavā, suttantiko so arahati aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍan”ti.

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.21.pli: “yo, bhagavā, vinayadharo so arahati aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍan”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:6.2.21.eng: the experts on the Monastic Law,

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.23.pli: “yo, bhagavā, dhammakathiko so arahati aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍan”ti.

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.25.pli: “yo, bhagavā, paṭhamassa jhānassa lābhī so arahati aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍan”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:6.2.25.eng: those who obtain the first absorption,

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.27.pli: “yo, bhagavā, dutiyassa jhānassa lābhī so arahati aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍan”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:6.2.27.eng: those who obtain the second absorption,

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.29.pli: “yo, bhagavā, tatiyassa jhānassa lābhī so arahati aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍan”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:6.2.29.eng: those who obtain the third absorption,

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.31.pli: “yo, bhagavā, catutthassa jhānassa lābhī so arahati aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍan”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:6.2.31.eng: those who obtain the fourth absorption,

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.33.pli: “yo, bhagavā, sotāpanno so arahati aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍan”ti.

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.37.pli: yo, bhagavā, arahā so arahati aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍan”ti.

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.39.pli: “yo, bhagavā, tevijjo so arahati aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍan”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:6.2.39.eng: those who have attained the three true insights,

pli-tv-kd16:6.2.41.pli: “yo, bhagavā, chaḷabhiñño so arahati aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍan”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:6.2.41.eng: or those who have attained the six direct knowledges deserve the best seat, water, and almsfood.”

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.1.eng: The Buddha then addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.2.1.eng: “Once upon a time, monks, there was a great banyan tree on the slopes of the Himalayas.
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.2.1.comm: Reading himavantapasse with the PTS edition. This story also exists as the Tittira Jātaka, number 37 of that collection.

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.4.pli: tittiro ca, makkaṭo ca, hatthināgo ca.
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.4.eng: a partridge, a monkey, and an elephant.

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.5.pli: Te aññamaññaṃ agāravā appatissā asabhāgavuttikā viharanti.
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.5.eng: They were disrespectful, undeferential, and rude toward one another.

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.6.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, tesaṃ sahāyānaṃ etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.7.pli: ‘aho nūna mayaṃ jāneyyāma yaṃ amhākaṃ jātiyā mahantataraṃ taṃ mayaṃ sakkareyyāma garuṃ kareyyāma māneyyāma pūjeyyāma, tassa ca mayaṃ ovāde tiṭṭheyyāmā’ti.
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.7.eng: ‘If we only knew which one of us was the oldest. We would honor, respect, and esteem him, and we would wait for his instructions.’

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.8.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, tittiro ca makkaṭo ca hatthināgaṃ pucchiṃsu—
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.8.eng: The partridge and the monkey then asked the elephant,

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.10.pli: ‘Yadāhaṃ, sammā, poto homi, imaṃ nigrodhaṃ antarā satthīnaṃ karitvā atikkamāmi, aggaṅkurakaṃ me udaraṃ chupati.
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.10.eng: ‘When I was young, I stepped over this banyan tree, keeping it between my legs, and the top shoots touched my belly.

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.12.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, tittiro ca hatthināgo ca makkaṭaṃ pucchiṃsu—
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.12.eng: The partridge and the elephant asked the monkey,

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.14.pli: ‘Yadāhaṃ, sammā, chāpo homi, chamāyaṃ nisīditvā imassa nigrodhassa aggaṅkurakaṃ khādāmi.
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.14.eng: ‘When I was young, I sat on the ground and ate the top shoots of this banyan tree.

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.16.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, makkaṭo ca hatthināgo ca tittiraṃ pucchiṃsu—
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.16.eng: The monkey and the elephant asked the partridge,

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.18.eng: ‘In such and such a spot there was a great banyan tree.

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.19.pli: Tato ahaṃ phalaṃ bhakkhitvā imasmiṃ okāse vaccaṃ akāsiṃ;
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.19.eng: I ate one of its fruits and defecated here.

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.20.eng: This banyan tree has grown from that.

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.21.eng: Well then, I must be the oldest one.’

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.22.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, makkaṭo ca hatthināgo ca tittiraṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.22.eng: The monkey and the elephant said to the partridge,

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.24.pli: Taṃ mayaṃ sakkarissāma garuṃ karissāma mānessāma pūjessāma, tuyhañca mayaṃ ovāde patiṭṭhissāmā’ti.
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.24.eng: We will honor, respect, and esteem you, and we’ll wait for your instructions.’

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.25.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, tittiro makkaṭañca hatthināgañca pañcasu sīlesu samādapesi, attanā ca pañcasu sīlesu samādāya vattati.
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.25.eng: The partridge had the monkey and the elephant take the five precepts, and he also undertook them himself.

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.26.pli: Te aññamaññaṃ sagāravā sappatissā sabhāgavuttikā viharitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.26.eng: They were respectful, deferential, and courteous toward one another. And when they died, they were reborn in a happy, heavenly destination.

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.27.pli: Evaṃ kho taṃ, bhikkhave, tittiriyaṃ nāma brahmacariyaṃ ahosi.
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.27.eng: In this way the spiritual life called tittiriya came to be.
pli-tv-kd16:6.3.27.comm: There seems to be a play on words here, in which tittiriya refers both to a partridge and to a class of brahmins.

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.29.eng: And who are learned in the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.30.eng: They are praised while still alive,

pli-tv-kd16:6.3.31.eng: And then go to a good destination.

pli-tv-kd16:6.4.1.pli: Te hi nāma, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā aññamaññaṃ sagāravā sappatissā sabhāgavuttikā viharissanti.
pli-tv-kd16:6.4.1.eng: “Even those animals, monks, were respectful, deferential, and courteous toward one another.

pli-tv-kd16:6.4.2.pli: Idha kho taṃ, bhikkhave, sobhetha yaṃ tumhe evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitā samānā aññamaññaṃ agāravā appatissā asabhāgavuttikā vihareyyātha?
pli-tv-kd16:6.4.2.eng: Having gone forth on this well-proclaimed spiritual path, will you look good if you are disrespectful, undeferential, and rude toward one another?
pli-tv-kd16:6.4.2.comm: Sp 3.248: Ettha tanti nipātamattaṁ, idha kho bhikkhave sobheyyāthāti attho, “Here taṁ is a mere indeclinable. The meaning is, ‘In this case, monks, would you shine?’”

pli-tv-kd16:6.4.5.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:6.4.6.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yathāvuḍḍhaṃ abhivādanaṃ, paccuṭṭhānaṃ, añjalikammaṃ, sāmīcikammaṃ, aggāsanaṃ, aggodakaṃ, aggapiṇḍaṃ.
pli-tv-kd16:6.4.6.eng: “You should do these things according to seniority: bowing down, standing up, raising your joined palms, doing acts of respect, giving the best seat, giving the best water, and giving the best almsfood.

pli-tv-kd16:6.4.7.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, saṅghikaṃ yathāvuḍḍhaṃ paṭibāhitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd16:6.4.7.eng: But what belongs to the Sangha shouldn’t be reserved according to seniority.
pli-tv-kd16:6.4.7.comm: Which effectively means that such things cannot be reserved at all.

pli-tv-kd16:6.4.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:6.5.0.eng: 12. Persons one should not pay respect to, etc.

pli-tv-kd16:6.5.1.eng: “Monks, you shouldn’t pay respect to any of these ten kinds of persons:

pli-tv-kd16:6.5.2.pli: pure upasampannena pacchā upasampanno avandiyo, anupasampanno avandiyo, nānāsaṃvāsako vuḍḍhataro adhammavādī avandiyo, mātugāmo avandiyo, paṇḍako avandiyo, pārivāsiko avandiyo, mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho avandiyo, mānattāraho avandiyo, mānattacāriko avandiyo, abbhānāraho avandiyo.
pli-tv-kd16:6.5.2.eng: one who’s been given the full ordination after you; one who isn’t fully ordained; one who belongs to a different Buddhist sect who’s senior to you, but who speaks contrary to the Teaching; a woman; a paṇḍaka; one who’s on probation; one who deserves to be sent back to the beginning; one who deserves the trial period; one who’s undertaking the trial period; one who deserves rehabilitation.
pli-tv-kd16:6.5.2.comm: For an explanation of the word paṇḍaka, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd16:6.5.4.eng: But you should pay respect to these three kinds of persons:

pli-tv-kd16:6.5.5.pli: pacchā upasampannena pure upasampanno vandiyo, nānāsaṃvāsako vuḍḍhataro dhammavādī vandiyo, sadevake bhikkhave loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya tathāgato arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vandiyo.
pli-tv-kd16:6.5.5.eng: one who’s been given the full ordination before you; one who belongs to a different Buddhist sect who’s senior to you and who speaks in accordance with the Teaching; and in this world with its gods, lords of death, and supreme beings, in this society with its monastics and brahmins, its gods and humans, you should pay respect to the Buddha, perfected and fully awakened.”

pli-tv-kd16:7.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā saṅghaṃ uddissa maṇḍape paṭiyādenti, santhare paṭiyādenti, okāse paṭiyādenti.
pli-tv-kd16:7.1.eng: At that time people prepared roof covers, mats, and places to stay for the Sangha.
pli-tv-kd16:7.1.comm: Vmv 4.313 defines okāsa as nivāsokāsa, “a place to stay”.

pli-tv-kd16:7.2.eng: The monks who were the pupils of the monks from the group of six, thought,

pli-tv-kd16:7.3.pli: “saṅghikaññeva bhagavatā yathāvuḍḍhaṃ anuññātaṃ, no uddissakatan”ti buddhappamukhassa saṅghassa purato purato gantvā maṇḍapepi pariggaṇhanti, santharepi pariggaṇhanti, okāsepi pariggaṇhanti—
pli-tv-kd16:7.3.eng: “The Buddha has instructed that what belongs to the Sangha shouldn’t be reserved according to seniority. But he’s given no such instruction about what has merely been prepared for the Sangha.” They then went ahead of the Sangha headed by the Buddha and took possession of the roof-covers, mats, and places to stay, thinking,
pli-tv-kd16:7.3.comm: To make this sentence fit the context I read saṅghikaññeva as saṅghikaṁ + na + eva.

pli-tv-kd16:7.4.pli: “idaṃ amhākaṃ upajjhāyānaṃ bhavissati, idaṃ amhākaṃ ācariyānaṃ bhavissati, idaṃ amhākaṃ bhavissatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:7.4.eng: “This will be for our preceptors and teachers, and also for ourselves.”

pli-tv-kd16:7.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto buddhappamukhassa saṅghassa piṭṭhito piṭṭhito gantvā maṇḍapesu pariggahitesu, santharesu pariggahitesu, okāsesu pariggahitesu, okāsaṃ alabhamāno aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd16:7.5.eng: Following behind the Sangha, Venerable Sāriputta was unable to find a place to stay—the roof-covers, the mats, and the places to stay having all been taken. And so he sat down at the foot of a tree.

pli-tv-kd16:7.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya ukkāsi.
pli-tv-kd16:7.6.eng: Getting up early in the morning, the Buddha cleared his throat.

pli-tv-kd16:7.11.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd16:7.11.eng: Sāriputta told the Buddha what had happened.

pli-tv-kd16:7.12.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd16:7.12.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:7.13.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ antevāsikā bhikkhū—
pli-tv-kd16:7.13.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monks who are the pupils of the monks from the group of six did this?”

pli-tv-kd16:7.14.pli: ‘saṅghikaññeva bhagavatā yathāvuḍḍhaṃ anuññātaṃ, no uddissakatan’ti buddhappamukhassa saṅghassa purato purato gantvā maṇḍape pariggaṇhanti, santhare pariggaṇhanti, okāse pariggaṇhanti—

pli-tv-kd16:7.15.pli: idaṃ amhākaṃ upajjhāyānaṃ bhavissati, idaṃ amhākaṃ ācariyānaṃ bhavissati, idaṃ amhākaṃ bhavissatī”ti?

pli-tv-kd16:7.18.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:7.19.eng: “Even what has merely been prepared for the Sangha shouldn’t be reserved according to seniority.
pli-tv-kd16:7.19.comm: Again, this effectively means that such things cannot be reserved at all.

pli-tv-kd16:7.20.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:8.0.eng: 14. The allowance for what belongs to a householder

pli-tv-kd16:8.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā bhattagge antaraghare uccāsayanamahāsayanāni paññapenti, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd16:8.1.eng: At that time people prepared high and luxurious resting places in the dining halls in inhabited areas, that is:

pli-tv-kd16:8.2.pli: āsandiṃ, pallaṅkaṃ, gonakaṃ, cittakaṃ, paṭikaṃ, paṭalikaṃ, tūlikaṃ, vikatikaṃ, uddalomiṃ, ekantalomiṃ, kaṭṭissaṃ, koseyyaṃ, kuttakaṃ, hatthattharaṃ, assattharaṃ, rathattharaṃ, ajinapaveṇiṃ, kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇaṃ, sauttaracchadaṃ, ubhatolohitakūpadhānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd16:8.2.eng: high couches, luxurious couches, long-fleeced woolen rugs, multi-colored woolen rugs, white woolen rugs, red woolen rugs, cotton-down quilts, woolen rugs decorated with the images of predatory animals, woolen rugs with long fleece on one side, woolen rugs with long fleece on both sides, sheets of silk embroidered with gems, silken sheets, woolen rugs like a dancer’s rug, elephant-back rugs, horse-back rugs, carriage-seat rugs, rugs made of black antelope hide, exquisite sheets made of kadalī-deer hide, seats with canopies, seats with red cushions at each end.
pli-tv-kd16:8.2.comm: For further discussion of these renderings, see Appendix of Furniture.

pli-tv-kd16:8.3.eng: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not sit on them.

pli-tv-kd16:8.6.eng: high couches, luxurious couches, and cotton-down quilts,

pli-tv-kd16:8.7.eng: I allow you to sit down on what belongs to householders, but not to lie down on it.”

pli-tv-kd16:8.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā bhattagge antaraghare tūlonaddhaṃ mañcampi pīṭhampi paññapenti.
pli-tv-kd16:8.8.eng: At that time people prepared beds and benches upholstered with cotton down in the dining halls in inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd16:8.9.eng: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not sit on them.

pli-tv-kd16:8.11.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gihivikataṃ abhinisīdituṃ, na tveva abhinipajjitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:8.11.eng: “I allow you to sit down on what belongs to householders, but not to lie down on it.”

pli-tv-kd16:9.0.eng: 15. The expression of appreciation for the Jeta Grove dwellings

pli-tv-kd16:9.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena sāvatthi tadavasari.
pli-tv-kd16:9.1.1.eng: Wandering on, the Buddha eventually arrived at Sāvatthī,

pli-tv-kd16:9.1.2.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd16:9.1.2.eng: where he stayed in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd16:9.1.3.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd16:9.1.3.eng: Anāthapiṇḍika then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd16:9.1.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd16:9.1.5.pli: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:9.1.5.eng: “Sir, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-kd16:9.1.6.eng: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

pli-tv-kd16:9.1.7.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd16:9.1.7.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, Anāthapiṇḍika got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd16:9.1.8.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati tassā rattiyā accayena paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṃ ārocāpesi—
pli-tv-kd16:9.1.8.eng: The following morning Anāthapiṇḍika had various kinds of fine foods prepared. He then had the Buddha informed

pli-tv-kd16:9.1.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena.
pli-tv-kd16:9.1.10.eng: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Anāthapiṇḍika’s house where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd16:9.1.11.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā, bhagavantaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ, ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd16:9.1.11.eng: Anāthapiṇḍika then personally served various kinds of fine foods to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha. When the Buddha had finished his meal and had washed his hands and bowl, Anāthapiṇḍika sat down to one side

pli-tv-kd16:9.1.12.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd16:9.1.13.eng: “Sir, what should I do in regard to the Jeta Grove?”

pli-tv-kd16:9.1.14.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, gahapati, jetavanaṃ āgatānāgatassa cātuddisassa saṅghassa patiṭṭhapehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:9.1.14.eng: “You should dedicate the Jeta Grove to the Sangha as a whole, both present and future.”

pli-tv-kd16:9.1.15.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati bhagavato paṭissutvā jetavanaṃ āgatānāgatassa cātuddisassa saṅghassa patiṭṭhāpesi.
pli-tv-kd16:9.1.15.eng: “Yes, sir.” And he did just that.

pli-tv-kd16:9.2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ imāhi gāthāhi anumodi—
pli-tv-kd16:9.2.1.eng: The Buddha then expressed his appreciation with these verses:

pli-tv-kd16:9.2.6.eng: They keep away the wind and burning sun,

pli-tv-kd16:9.2.8.eng: Their purpose is to shelter and for happiness,

pli-tv-kd16:9.2.9.eng: To attain absorption and to see clearly.

pli-tv-kd16:9.2.11.eng: Is praised as the best by the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd16:9.2.15.eng: And have the learned stay there.

pli-tv-kd16:9.2.20.eng: They will give him the Teaching

pli-tv-kd16:9.2.22.eng: And understanding this Teaching in this very life,

pli-tv-kd16:9.2.23.eng: He attains extinguishment, free of corruptions.”

pli-tv-kd16:9.2.24.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ imāhi gāthāhi anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd16:9.2.24.eng: The Buddha then got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa ājīvakasāvakassa mahāmattassa saṅghabhattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.1.eng: On one occasion a certain government official who was an Ājīvaka disciple was offering a meal to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.2.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto pacchā āgantvā vippakatabhojanaṃ ānantarikaṃ bhikkhuṃ vuṭṭhāpesi.
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.2.eng: Arriving late, Venerable Upananda the Sakyan made the nearest monk get up before he had finished his meal.

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.3.eng: There was an uproar in the dining hall.
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.3.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “dining hall” for bhattagga, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.4.pli: Atha kho so mahāmatto ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.4.eng: That official then complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā pacchā āgantvā vippakatabhojanaṃ ānantarikaṃ bhikkhuṃ vuṭṭhāpessanti.
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.5.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics arrive late and make the nearest monk get up in the middle of his meal?

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.6.eng: There was an uproar in the dining hall.

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.7.pli: Nanu nāma labbhā aññatrāpi nisinnena yāvadatthaṃ bhuñjitun”ti?
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.7.eng: It’s impossible to eat as much as you like when you’re not seated.”

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.8.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tassa mahāmattassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.8.eng: The monks heard the complaints of that official,

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.9.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.9.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.10.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando sakyaputto pacchā āgantvā vippakatabhojanaṃ ānantarikaṃ bhikkhuṃ vuṭṭhāpessati.

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.12.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.12.eng: They told the Buddha what had happened.

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.13.pli: “Saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, upananda, pacchā āgantvā vippakatabhojanaṃ ānantarikaṃ bhikkhuṃ vuṭṭhāpesi, bhattaggaṃ kolāhalaṃ ahosī”ti?
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.13.eng: “Is it true, Upananda, that you acted like this?”

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.16.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, pacchā āgantvā vippakatabhojanaṃ ānantarikaṃ bhikkhuṃ vuṭṭhāpessasi?
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.16.eng: “Foolish man, how could you act like this?

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.20.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.21.eng: “You shouldn’t make a monk get up who hasn’t finished his meal.

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.22.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.23.pli: Sace vuṭṭhāpeti, pavārito ca hoti, ‘gaccha udakaṃ āharā’ti vattabbo.
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.23.eng: If you’re asked to get up, and you’ve already refused an invitation to eat more, you should say, “Please go and get some water.”
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.23.comm: Sp 3.316: Pavārito ca hotīti yaṁ so vuṭṭhāpeti, ayañca bhikkhu pavārito ca hoti, tena vattabbo – “gaccha udakaṁ āharāhī”ti, “‘Have already refused an invitation to eat more’: whom he asks to get up, this monk has already refused an invitation to eat more. He should say, ‘Go and get some water.’” In other words, it is the monk who is asked to get up who has refused the invitation to eat more. The point is that this prohibits him from continuing his meal elsewhere after getting up. According to Bu Pc 35:2.15.1, once you have refused an invitation to eat more and risen from your seat, you cannot eat anything further. For further discussion, see pavāraṇā in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.24.eng: If the other goes, all is well.

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.25.pli: No ce labhetha, sādhukaṃ sitthāni gilitvā vuḍḍhatarassa bhikkhuno āsanaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.25.eng: If not, you should properly swallow the mouthful and give the seat to the more senior monk.

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.26.pli: Na tvevāhaṃ, bhikkhave, kenaci pariyāyena vuḍḍhatarassa bhikkhuno āsanaṃ paṭibāhitabbanti vadāmi.
pli-tv-kd16:10.1.26.eng: Under no circumstances should you block a more senior monk from a seat.

pli-tv-kd16:10.1.27.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:10.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū gilāne bhikkhū vuṭṭhāpenti.
pli-tv-kd16:10.2.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six asked the sick monks to get up.

pli-tv-kd16:10.2.3.eng: “We’re not able to get up. We’re sick.”

pli-tv-kd16:10.2.4.pli: “Mayaṃ āyasmante vuṭṭhāpessāmā”ti pariggahetvā vuṭṭhāpetvā ṭhitake muñcanti.
pli-tv-kd16:10.2.4.eng: Saying, “We’ll make the venerables get up,” they took hold of them, lifted them up, and then released them when they were standing.

pli-tv-kd16:10.2.5.eng: The sick monks fainted and collapsed.

pli-tv-kd16:10.2.7.eng: “You shouldn’t make the sick get up.

pli-tv-kd16:10.2.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:10.2.9.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū—
pli-tv-kd16:10.2.9.eng: The monks from the group of six took possession of the best beds, saying,

pli-tv-kd16:10.2.10.eng: “We’re sick and no-one can make us get up.”

pli-tv-kd16:10.2.12.eng: “You should give suitable beds to those who are sick.”

pli-tv-kd16:10.2.13.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū lesakappena senāsanaṃ paṭibāhanti.
pli-tv-kd16:10.2.13.eng: The monks from the group of six used a pretext to reserve resting places.
pli-tv-kd16:10.2.13.comm: Sp 4.316: Lesakappenāti appakena sīsābādhādimattena, “Pretext: merely a minor headache.”

pli-tv-kd16:10.2.15.eng: “You shouldn’t use a pretext to reserve a resting place.
pli-tv-kd16:10.2.15.comm: For an explanation of rendering senāsana as “resting place”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd16:10.2.16.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū aññataraṃ paccantimaṃ mahāvihāraṃ paṭisaṅkharonti—
pli-tv-kd16:11.1.1.eng: At that time the monks from the group of seventeen were repairing a large dwelling nearby,

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.2.eng: intending to stay there for the rainy season.

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.3.pli: Addasaṃsu kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sattarasavaggiye bhikkhū vihāraṃ paṭisaṅkharonte.
pli-tv-kd16:11.1.3.eng: The monks from the group of six saw this

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.5.eng: “These monks from the group of seventeen are repairing a dwelling.

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.8.eng: “Let’s wait until they’ve finished repairing it.”

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.9.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sattarasavaggiye bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd16:11.1.9.eng: Soon afterwards the monks from the group of six said to those from the group of seventeen,

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.12.eng: We would have repaired another one.”

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.13.eng: “Doesn’t this dwelling belong to the Sangha?”

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.15.eng: “Well then, leave. This dwelling is ours.”

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.17.eng: You can stay here and so can we.”

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.18.pli: “Uṭṭhethāvuso, amhākaṃ vihāro pāpuṇātī”ti kupitā anattamanā gīvāyaṃ gahetvā nikkaḍḍhanti.
pli-tv-kd16:11.1.18.eng: But they said, “Leave, this dwelling is ours,” and they grabbed them by the necks and threw them out in anger.

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.19.eng: The monks from the group of seventeen cried.

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.20.eng: When other monks asked them why,

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.22.pli: “Ime, āvuso, chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kupitā anattamanā amhe saṅghikā vihārā nikkaḍḍhantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:11.1.22.eng: they told them what had happened.

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.23.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd16:11.1.23.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.24.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kupitā anattamanā bhikkhū saṅghikā vihārā nikkaḍḍhissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:11.1.24.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six angrily throw other monks out of a dwelling belonging to the Sangha?”

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.25.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd16:11.1.25.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.26.pli: “saccaṃ kira, tumhe bhikkhave, kupitā anattamanā saṅghikā vihārā bhikkhū nikkaḍḍhathā”ti?
pli-tv-kd16:11.1.26.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.29.eng: and after giving a teaching, he addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.30.pli: “na, bhikkhave, kupitena anattamanena bhikkhu saṅghikā vihārā nikkaḍḍhitabbo.
pli-tv-kd16:11.1.30.eng: “You shouldn’t, in anger, throw a monk out of a dwelling belonging to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd16:11.1.31.eng: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.0.eng: 17. The appointment of allocators of dwellings

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.2.comm: Again, see senāsana in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.3.eng: They told the Buddha, who then gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.4.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgataṃ bhikkhuṃ senāsanaggāhāpakaṃ sammannituṃ—
pli-tv-kd16:11.2.4.eng: “You should appoint a monk who has five qualities as the allocator of dwellings:

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.5.pli: yo na chandāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na dosāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na mohāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na bhayāgatiṃ gaccheyya, gahitāgahitañca jāneyya.
pli-tv-kd16:11.2.5.eng: one who’s not biased by favoritism, ill will, confusion, or fear, and who knows which dwellings have and have not been allocated.

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.6.eng: And he should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.7.pli: Paṭhamaṃ bhikkhu yācitabbo, yācitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd16:11.2.7.eng: First a monk should be asked, and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.8.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.9.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ senāsanaggāhāpakaṃ sammanneyya.
pli-tv-kd16:11.2.9.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint monk so-and-so as allocator of dwellings.

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.11.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.12.eng: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as allocator of dwellings.

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.13.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno senāsanaggāhāpakassa sammuti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd16:11.2.13.eng: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so as allocator of dwellings should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.14.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.15.eng: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so as allocator of dwellings.

pli-tv-kd16:11.2.16.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:11.2.16.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, paṭhamaṃ bhikkhū gaṇetuṃ, bhikkhū gaṇetvā seyyā gaṇetuṃ, seyyā gaṇetvā seyyaggena gāhetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:11.3.4.eng: “First you should count the monks and the beds. You should then allocate one monk to each bed.”
pli-tv-kd16:11.3.4.comm: “One monk to each bed” renders seyyaggena. Sp 4.318: Seyyaggenāti seyyāparicchedena, vassūpanāyikadivase kālaṁ ghosetvā ekamañcaṭṭhānaṁ ekassa bhikkhuno gāhetuṁ anujānāmīti attho, “Seyyaggena means by dividing the beds; the meaning is I allow you, after announcing the time on the day for entering the rainy-season residence, to allocate one bed-place to one monk.”

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.5.eng: When they had allocated the beds, there were beds left over.

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.6.eng: “You should allocate one monk to each dwelling.”

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.7.eng: When they had allocated the dwellings, there were dwellings left over.

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.8.eng: “You should allocate one monk to each yard.”

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.9.eng: When they had allocated the yards, there were yards left over.

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.10.comm: Sp 4.318: Anubhāganti puna aparampi bhāgaṁ dātuṁ. Atimandesu hi bhikkhūsu ekekassa bhikkhuno dve tīṇi pariveṇāni dātabbāni, “Anubhāga to give another part too. Two or three yards are to be given to a single monk among excessively foolish monks.”

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.11.pli: Gahite anubhāge añño bhikkhu āgacchati, akāmā na dātabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:11.3.11.eng: If another monk arrives after the additional shares have been allocated, then, if you’re unwilling, you need not give him a share.”

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.12.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū nissīme ṭhitassa senāsanaṃ gāhenti.
pli-tv-kd16:11.3.12.eng: On one occasion the monks allocated a dwelling to one who was outside the monastery zone.
pli-tv-kd16:11.3.12.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “monastery zone” for sīmā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.14.eng: “You shouldn’t allocate a dwelling to one outside the monastery zone.

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.15.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.16.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū senāsanaṃ gahetvā sabbakālaṃ paṭibāhanti.
pli-tv-kd16:11.3.16.eng: After accepting a dwelling, the monks reserved it at all times.

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.18.eng: “After accepting a dwelling, you shouldn’t reserve it at all times.

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.19.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd16:11.3.20.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, vassānaṃ temāsaṃ paṭibāhituṃ, utukālaṃ pana na paṭibāhitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:11.3.20.eng: I allow you to reserve it for the three months of the rainy-season residence, but not at other times.”

pli-tv-kd16:11.4.2.eng: “How many times are there for the allocation of dwellings?”

pli-tv-kd16:11.4.4.eng: “There are three times for the allocation of dwellings:

pli-tv-kd16:11.4.5.eng: the first, the second, and when given up in between.
pli-tv-kd16:11.4.5.comm: “When given up in between” renders antarāmuttaka. This is obscure. Sp-yoj 4.318: Antarā dvīhi vassūpanāyikadivasehi mutte kāle gāho antarāmuttako, “When the time it is given up is in between the two days for entering the rainy season retreat, then the allocation is given up in between.” This would seem to refer to what is relinquished between the former and the latter entry to the rainy-season residence. I am not sure, however, whether this judgment makes sense, since such a dwelling might then be allocated for the second rainy-season residence, which is already covered. It seems to me, rather, that antarāmuttaka must refer to any dwelling that has been either vacant for the whole rainy-season residence or vacated during the rainy-season residence.

pli-tv-kd16:11.4.6.eng: The first allocation is on the day after the full moon of July.

pli-tv-kd16:11.4.7.eng: The second allocation is one month after the full moon of July.

pli-tv-kd16:11.4.8.pli: Aparajjugatāya pavāraṇāya āyatiṃ vassāvāsatthāya antarāmuttako gāhetabbo.
pli-tv-kd16:11.4.8.eng: The allocation of what is given up in between is on the day after the invitation ceremony and is for the purpose of spending the next rains residence.”

pli-tv-kd16:11.4.10.eng: The second section for recitation is finished.

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto sāvatthiyaṃ senāsanaṃ gahetvā aññataraṃ gāmakāvāsaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd16:12.1.1.eng: On one occasion Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had accepted a dwelling at Sāvatthī, but then went to a certain village monastery,

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.2.eng: where he was also allocated a dwelling.

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.4.pli: “ayaṃ, āvuso, āyasmā upanando sakyaputto bhaṇḍanakārako kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako.
pli-tv-kd16:12.1.4.eng: “This Upananda is quarrelsome and argumentative, and creates legal issues in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.5.pli: Sacāyaṃ idha vassaṃ vasissati, sabbeva mayaṃ na phāsu bhavissāma.
pli-tv-kd16:12.1.5.eng: If he spends the rainy season here, none of us will be at ease.

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.7.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.8.pli: “nanu tayā, āvuso upananda, sāvatthiyaṃ senāsanaṃ gahitan”ti?
pli-tv-kd16:12.1.8.eng: “Haven’t you been allocated a dwelling at Sāvatthī?”

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.10.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, āvuso upananda, eko dve paṭibāhasī”ti?
pli-tv-kd16:12.1.10.eng: “But if it’s only you, why do you reserve two dwellings?”

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.12.eng: and take the one at Sāvatthī.”

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.13.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd16:12.1.13.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.14.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando sakyaputto eko dve paṭibāhessatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:12.1.14.eng: “How could Upananda reserve two dwellings for himself?”

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.15.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Upananda:

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.16.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, upananda, eko dve paṭibāhasī”ti?
pli-tv-kd16:12.1.16.eng: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.19.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, eko dve paṭibāhissasi?
pli-tv-kd16:12.1.19.eng: “Foolish man, how could you reserve two dwellings for yourself?

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.20.pli: Tattha tayā, moghapurisa, gahitaṃ idha muttaṃ, idha tayā gahitaṃ tatra muttaṃ.
pli-tv-kd16:12.1.20.eng: When you accepted a dwelling there, the dwelling here was given up, and when you accepted a dwelling here, the dwelling there was given up.
pli-tv-kd16:12.1.20.comm: My translation is a paraphrasing that accords with the explanation given in the commentary at Sp 4.319. The Canonical phrasing is succinct to the point of being incomprehensible.

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.21.pli: Evaṃ kho tvaṃ, moghapurisa, ubhayattha paribāhiro.

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.24.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.25.eng: “A single monk shouldn’t reserve two dwellings.

pli-tv-kd16:12.1.26.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:13.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā bhikkhūnaṃ anekapariyāyena vinayakathaṃ kathesi, vinayassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, vinayapariyattiyā vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, ādissa ādissa āyasmato upālissa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati.
pli-tv-kd16:13.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was giving many talks on the Monastic Law. He spoke in praise of it and of learning it, and he repeatedly praised Venerable Upāli.

pli-tv-kd16:13.1.2.eng: When they heard this, the monks thought,

pli-tv-kd16:13.1.3.pli: “bhagavā kho anekapariyāyena vinayakathaṃ katheti, vinayassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, vinayapariyattiyā vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, ādissa ādissa āyasmato upālissa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati.

pli-tv-kd16:13.1.4.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, āyasmato upālissa santike vinayaṃ pariyāpuṇāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:13.1.4.eng: “Well then, let’s learn the Monastic Law from Venerable Upāli.”

pli-tv-kd16:13.1.5.pli: Tedha bahū bhikkhū therā ca navā ca majjhimā ca āyasmato upālissa santike vinayaṃ pariyāpuṇanti.
pli-tv-kd16:13.1.5.eng: And many monks, both senior and junior, as well as those of middle standing, learned the Monastic Law from Upāli.

pli-tv-kd16:13.1.6.pli: Āyasmā upāli ṭhitakova uddisati therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ gāravena.
pli-tv-kd16:13.1.6.eng: Out of respect for the senior monks, Upāli taught while standing.

pli-tv-kd16:13.1.7.eng: And out of respect for the Teaching, the senior monks, too, were standing.

pli-tv-kd16:13.1.8.pli: Tattha therā ceva bhikkhū kilamanti, āyasmā ca upāli kilamati.

pli-tv-kd16:13.1.10.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, navakena bhikkhunā uddisantena samake vā āsane nisīdituṃ, uccatare vā dhammagāravena;
pli-tv-kd16:13.1.10.eng: “A junior monk who’s teaching should sit on a similar or higher seat out of respect for the Teaching.

pli-tv-kd16:13.1.11.pli: therena bhikkhunā uddisāpentena samake vā āsane nisīdituṃ, nīcatare vā dhammagāravenā”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:13.1.11.eng: A senior monk who’s being taught should sit on a similar or lower seat out of respect for the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd16:13.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bahū bhikkhū āyasmato upālissa santike ṭhitakā uddesaṃ paṭimānentā kilamanti.
pli-tv-kd16:13.2.1.eng: On one occasion many monks were standing in the presence of Upāli, honoring the recitation. They became tired.

pli-tv-kd16:13.2.3.eng: “I allow those who are entitled to sit on the same seat to sit together.”

pli-tv-kd16:13.2.5.eng: “Who are entitled to sit on the same seat?”

pli-tv-kd16:13.2.7.eng: “I allow those with a difference of three years or less in seniority to sit together.”

pli-tv-kd16:13.2.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū samānāsanikā mañce nisīditvā mañcaṃ bhindiṃsu, pīṭhe nisīditvā pīṭhaṃ bhindiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd16:13.2.8.eng: On one occasion a number of monks who were entitled to sit on the same seat were seated on a bed. The bed broke. They were seated on the same bench, and the bench broke.

pli-tv-kd16:13.2.10.eng: “I allow a maximum of three on the same bed or bench.”

pli-tv-kd16:13.2.11.pli: Tivaggopi mañce nisīditvā mañcaṃ bhindi, pīṭhe nisīditvā pīṭhaṃ bhindi …pe…
pli-tv-kd16:13.2.11.eng: The beds and benches still broke.

pli-tv-kd16:13.2.12.eng: “I allow a maximum of two on the same bed or bench.”

pli-tv-kd16:13.2.13.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū asamānāsanikehi saha dīghāsane nisīdituṃ kukkuccāyanti.
pli-tv-kd16:13.2.13.eng: At that time, being afraid of wrongdoing, monks who were not entitled to sit on the same seat did not sit together on a long seat.

pli-tv-kd16:13.2.15.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ṭhapetvā paṇḍakaṃ, mātugāmaṃ, ubhatobyañjanakaṃ, asamānāsanikehi saha dīghāsane nisīditun”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:13.2.15.eng: “I allow those who aren’t entitled to sit on the same seat to sit together on a long seat, except with a paṇḍaka, a woman, or a hermaphrodite.”
pli-tv-kd16:13.2.15.comm: For the rendering “gynandromorph” for ubhatobyañjanaka, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd16:13.2.17.eng: “What’s the size of the smallest long seat?”

pli-tv-kd16:13.2.19.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yaṃ tiṇṇaṃ pahoti, ettakaṃ pacchimaṃ dīghāsanan”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:13.2.19.eng: “A seat for three is the smallest long seat.”

pli-tv-kd16:14.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena visākhā migāramātā saṅghassa atthāya sāḷindaṃ pāsādaṃ kārāpetukāmā hoti hatthinakhakaṃ.
pli-tv-kd16:14.1.1.eng: At one time Visākhā Migāramātā wanted to build a stilt house for the benefit of the Sangha, including a porch and elephant globes.
pli-tv-kd16:14.1.1.comm: “Elephant globes” renders hatthinakhaka, literally, “elephant nails”. Sp 4.319: Hatthinakhakanti hatthikumbhe patiṭṭhitaṁ; evaṁ katassa kiretaṁ nāmaṁ, “Hatthinakhaka means established on elephant globes; this is a name for what is made in this way.” Elephant globes are the frontal globes on an elephant’s forehead.

pli-tv-kd16:14.1.3.pli: “kiṃ nu kho bhagavatā pāsādaparibhogo anuññāto kiṃ ananuññāto”ti?
pli-tv-kd16:14.1.3.eng: “What stilt-house equipment has the Buddha allowed and what hasn’t he allowed?”

pli-tv-kd16:14.1.6.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rañño pasenadissa kosalassa ayyikā kālaṅkatā hoti.
pli-tv-kd16:14.1.6.eng: At one time King Pasenadi of Kosala’s grandmother had just died.

pli-tv-kd16:14.1.7.pli: Tassa kālaṅkiriyāya saṅghassa bahuṃ akappiyabhaṇḍaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd16:14.1.7.eng: As a result, many unallowable goods were offered to the Sangha, that is:
pli-tv-kd16:14.1.7.comm: All the following items seem to fall into the category seat/bed (see Kd 16:8.7 and Kd 5:10.5.1), the two often not being differentiated in the Canonical texts. In other words, beds were often used as seats, and vice versa.

pli-tv-kd16:14.1.8.pli: āsandi, pallaṅko, gonako, cittako, paṭikā, paṭalikā, tūlikā, vikatikā, uddalomī, ekantalomī, kaṭṭissaṃ, koseyyaṃ, kuttakaṃ, hatthattharaṃ, assattharaṃ, rathattharaṃ, ajinapaveṇi, kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇaṃ, sauttaracchadaṃ, ubhatolohitakūpadhānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd16:14.1.8.eng: high couches, luxurious couches, long-fleeced woolen rugs, multi-colored woolen rugs, white woolen rugs, red woolen rugs, cotton-down quilts, woolen rugs decorated with the images of predatory animals, woolen rugs with long fleece on one side, woolen rugs with long fleece on both sides, sheets of silk embroidered with gems, silken sheets, woolen rugs like a dancer’s rug, elephant-back rugs, horse-back rugs, carriage-seat rugs, rugs made of black antelope hide, exquisite sheets made of kadalī-deer hide, seats with canopies, and seats with red cushions at each end.
pli-tv-kd16:14.1.8.comm: For further discussion of these, see Appendix of Furniture.

pli-tv-kd16:14.1.10.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, āsandiyā pāde chinditvā paribhuñjituṃ, pallaṅkassa vāḷe bhinditvā paribhuñjituṃ, tūlikaṃ vijaṭetvā bibbohanaṃ kātuṃ, avasesaṃ bhūmattharaṇaṃ kātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:14.1.10.eng: “I allow you to use a high couch after cutting its legs down to size, to use a luxurious couch after removing the images of predatory animals, to make a pillow after removing the cotton down from the cotton-down quilt, and to make floor covers of the rest.”

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.0.eng: 19. What is not to be given away

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyā avidūre aññatarasmiṃ gāmakāvāse āvāsikā bhikkhū upaddutā honti āgantukagamikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapentā.
pli-tv-kd16:15.1.1.eng: At one time in a village monastery not far from Sāvatthī the resident monks were fed up with assigning dwellings to monks who were coming and going.

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.3.pli: “etarahi kho mayaṃ, āvuso, upaddutā āgantukagamikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapentā.

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.4.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, sabbaṃ saṅghikaṃ senāsanaṃ ekassa dema.
pli-tv-kd16:15.1.4.eng: and thought, “Well, let’s give all the dwellings belonging to the Sangha to one of us.

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.5.eng: We’ll then use what belongs to him.”

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.6.pli: Te sabbaṃ saṅghikaṃ senāsanaṃ ekassa adaṃsu.

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.7.eng: When newly-arrived monks said to them,

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.9.eng: they replied, “There aren’t any dwellings belonging to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.10.eng: We’ve given them to one monk.”

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.11.pli: “Kiṃ pana tumhe, āvuso, saṅghikaṃ senāsanaṃ vissajjethā”ti?
pli-tv-kd16:15.1.11.eng: “So you’ve given away the dwellings belonging to the Sangha?”

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.13.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd16:15.1.13.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.14.eng: “How could they give away the dwellings belonging to the Sangha?”

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.15.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd16:15.1.15.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.16.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū saṅghikaṃ senāsanaṃ vissajjentī”ti?
pli-tv-kd16:15.1.16.eng: “Is it true, monks, that they did this?”

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.19.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā saṅghikaṃ senāsanaṃ vissajjessanti?
pli-tv-kd16:15.1.19.eng: “How could those foolish men give away dwellings belonging to the Sangha?

pli-tv-kd16:15.1.22.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:15.2.1.pli: “Pañcimāni, bhikkhave, avissajjiyāni, na vissajjetabbāni, saṅghena vā gaṇena vā puggalena vā.
pli-tv-kd16:15.2.1.eng: “There are five things not to be given away, either by a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-kd16:15.2.2.eng: Even if given away, they’re not actually given away.

pli-tv-kd16:15.2.3.eng: If you give any of them away, you commit a serious offense.

pli-tv-kd16:15.2.5.eng: A monastery or the site of a monastery

pli-tv-kd16:15.2.6.pli: idaṃ paṭhamaṃ avissajjiyaṃ, na vissajjetabbaṃ, saṅghena vā gaṇena vā puggalena vā.

pli-tv-kd16:15.2.9.eng: A dwelling or the site of a dwelling

pli-tv-kd16:15.2.10.pli: idaṃ dutiyaṃ avissajjiyaṃ, na vissajjetabbaṃ, saṅghena vā gaṇena vā puggalena vā.

pli-tv-kd16:15.2.13.eng: A bed, bench, mattress, or pillow

pli-tv-kd16:15.2.14.pli: idaṃ tatiyaṃ avissajjiyaṃ, na vissajjetabbaṃ, saṅghena vā gaṇena vā puggalena vā.

pli-tv-kd16:15.2.17.pli: Lohakumbhī, lohabhāṇakaṃ, lohavārako, lohakaṭāhaṃ, vāsi, parasu, kuṭhārī, kudālo, nikhādanaṃ—
pli-tv-kd16:15.2.17.eng: A metal pot, a metal jar, a metal bucket, a metal bowl, an adz, a hatchet, an ax, a spade, or a chisel

pli-tv-kd16:15.2.18.pli: idaṃ catutthaṃ avissajjiyaṃ, na vissajjetabbaṃ, saṅghena vā gaṇena vā puggalena vā.

pli-tv-kd16:15.2.21.pli: Valli, veḷu, muñjaṃ, pabbajaṃ, tiṇaṃ, mattikā, dārubhaṇḍaṃ, mattikābhaṇḍaṃ—
pli-tv-kd16:15.2.21.eng: A creeper, bamboo, reed, grass, clay, wooden goods, or ceramic goods.”
pli-tv-kd16:15.2.21.comm: I have rendered muñja-reed and pabbaja-reed with the single word “reed”. I am not aware that these two kinds of reed can be distinguished in English.
