pli-tv-kd16:16.1.0.eng: 20. What is not to be distributed

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena kīṭāgiri tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi sāriputtamoggallānehi ca.
pli-tv-kd16:16.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Sāvatthī for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Kīṭāgiri with a large sangha of five hundred monks, including Sāriputta and Mahāmoggallāna.

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.2.eng: The monks Assaji and Punabbasuka heard about this and said,

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.3.pli: “bhagavā kira kīṭāgiriṃ āgacchati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi sāriputtamoggallānehi ca.

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.4.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, sabbaṃ saṅghikaṃ senāsanaṃ bhājema.
pli-tv-kd16:16.1.4.eng: “Well then, let’s distribute all the dwellings belonging to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.5.pli: Pāpicchā sāriputtamoggallānā, pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gatā;
pli-tv-kd16:16.1.5.eng: Sāriputta and Mahāmoggallāna are in the grip of bad desires.

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.6.pli: na mayaṃ tesaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapessāmā”ti, te sabbaṃ saṅghikaṃ senāsanaṃ bhājesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd16:16.1.6.eng: So let’s not assign them any dwellings.” And they distributed all the dwellings belonging to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena kīṭāgiri tadavasari.
pli-tv-kd16:16.1.7.eng: When the Buddha eventually arrived at Kīṭāgiri,

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.8.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sambahule bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd16:16.1.8.eng: he said to a group of monks,

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.10.eng: “Go to the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka and say,

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.11.pli: ‘bhagavā, āvuso, āgacchati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi sāriputtamoggallānehi ca.
pli-tv-kd16:16.1.11.eng: ‘The Buddha is coming with a large sangha of five hundred monks, including Sāriputta and Mahāmoggallāna.

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.12.pli: Bhagavato ca, āvuso, senāsanaṃ paññapetha, bhikkhusaṅghassa ca, sāriputtamoggallānānañcā’”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:16.1.12.eng: Please assign dwellings to the Buddha, to the Sangha of monks, and to Sāriputta and Mahāmoggallāna.’”

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.13.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paṭissutvā yena assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā assajipunabbasuke bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd16:16.1.13.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” they did just that.

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.14.pli: “bhagavā, āvuso, āgacchati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi sāriputtamoggallānehi ca.

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.15.pli: Bhagavato ca, āvuso, senāsanaṃ paññapetha, bhikkhusaṅghassa ca, sāriputtamoggallānānañcā”ti.

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.16.eng: The monks Assaji and Punabbasuka replied, “There aren’t any dwellings belonging to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.19.pli: Yasmiṃ vihāre bhagavā icchissati tasmiṃ vihāre vasissati.
pli-tv-kd16:16.1.19.eng: and he may stay wherever he likes.

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.20.pli: Pāpicchā sāriputtamoggallānā, pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gatā.
pli-tv-kd16:16.1.20.eng: But Sāriputta and Mahāmoggallāna are in the grip of bad desires.

pli-tv-kd16:16.1.21.eng: We won’t assign them any dwellings.”

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.1.pli: “Kiṃ pana tumhe, āvuso, saṅghikaṃ senāsanaṃ bhājitthā”ti?
pli-tv-kd16:16.2.1.eng: “So you’ve distributed the dwellings belonging to the Sangha?”

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.3.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd16:16.2.3.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū saṅghikaṃ senāsanaṃ bhājessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:16.2.4.eng: “How could they distribute the dwellings belonging to the Sangha?”

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd16:16.2.5.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.6.eng: “Is it true, monks, that they did this?”

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.9.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā saṅghikaṃ senāsanaṃ bhājessanti?
pli-tv-kd16:16.2.9.eng: “How could those foolish men distribute the dwellings belonging to the Sangha?

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.12.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.13.pli: “Pañcimāni, bhikkhave, avebhaṅgiyāni, na vibhajitabbāni, saṅghena vā gaṇena vā puggalena vā.
pli-tv-kd16:16.2.13.eng: “There are five things not to be distributed, either by a sangha, a group, or an individual.
pli-tv-kd16:16.2.13.comm: It is not immediately clear how “distributing” is different from “giving” in the previous section. Presumably “giving” refers to a change in ownership. Following the usage elsewhere, such as in the case of the distribution of dwellings, it seems reasonable to assume that “distributing” also here refers to a right of usage, not to a change in ownership. We can surmise from the context that “distribution” gives a stronger right to usage than “allocation”, for which see below.

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.14.eng: Even if distributed, they’re not actually distributed.

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.15.eng: If you distribute any of them, you commit a serious offense.

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.17.eng: A monastery or the land of a monastery

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.18.pli: idaṃ paṭhamaṃ avebhaṅgiyaṃ, na vibhajitabbaṃ, saṅghena vā gaṇena vā puggalena vā.

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.21.eng: A dwelling or the land of a dwelling

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.22.pli: idaṃ dutiyaṃ avebhaṅgiyaṃ, na vibhajitabbaṃ, saṅghena vā gaṇena vā puggalena vā.

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.25.eng: A bed, bench, mattress, or pillow

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.26.pli: idaṃ tatiyaṃ avebhaṅgiyaṃ, na vibhajitabbaṃ, saṅghena vā gaṇena vā puggalena vā.

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.29.pli: Lohakumbhī, lohabhāṇakaṃ, lohavārako, lohakaṭāhaṃ, vāsī, parasu, kuṭhārī, kudālo, nikhādanaṃ—
pli-tv-kd16:16.2.29.eng: A metal pot, a metal jar, a metal bucket, a metal bowl, an adz, a hatchet, an ax, a spade, or a chisel

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.30.pli: idaṃ catutthaṃ avebhaṅgiyaṃ, na vibhajitabbaṃ, saṅghena vā gaṇena vā puggalena vā.

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.33.pli: Vallī, veḷu, muñjaṃ, pabbajaṃ, tiṇaṃ, mattikā, dārubhaṇḍaṃ, mattikābhaṇḍaṃ—
pli-tv-kd16:16.2.33.eng: A creeper, bamboo, reed, grass, clay, wooden goods, or ceramic goods.”

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.34.pli: idaṃ pañcamaṃ avebhaṅgiyaṃ, na vibhajitabbaṃ, saṅghena vā gaṇena vā puggalena vā.

pli-tv-kd16:16.2.37.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca avebhaṅgiyāni, na vibhajitabbāni, saṅghena vā gaṇena vā puggalena vā.

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.0.eng: 21. Discussion on putting in charge of building work

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā kīṭāgirismiṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena āḷavī tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd16:17.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Kīṭāgiri for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Āḷavī.

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena āḷavī tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā āḷaviyaṃ viharati aggāḷave cetiye.

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āḷavakā bhikkhū evarūpāni navakammāni denti—
pli-tv-kd16:17.1.4.eng: At that time the monks of Āḷava put monks in charge of building work such as this:

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.5.comm: Vmv 4.323: Pāḷiyaṁ piṇḍanikkhepanamattenātiādīsu khaṇḍaphullaṭṭhāne mattikāpiṇḍaṭṭhapanaṁ piṇḍanikkhepanaṁ nāma, “Among piṇḍanikkhepanamattena, etc., in the Canonical text, the placing of bits of clay in the gaps and cracks is called piṇḍanikkhepana.”

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.8.eng: the mere making of door jambs,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.10.eng: the mere application of white coloring,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.11.eng: the mere application of black coloring,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.12.eng: the mere treatment with red ocher,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.13.eng: the mere covering with a roof,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.14.eng: the mere fastening of a roof,
pli-tv-kd16:17.1.14.comm: Vmv 4.323: Bandhanaṁ nāma daṇḍavalliādīhi chadanabandhanameva, “Just the binding of a roof with sticks and creepers, etc., is called bandhana.”

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.15.comm: The meaning of bhaṇḍikāṭṭhapanamatta is not clear. I follow the suggestion given in DOP, sv. “kapota”.

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.16.eng: the mere repair of what was defective or broken,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.17.eng: and the mere plastering of floors;
pli-tv-kd16:17.1.17.comm: Sp 4.323: Paribhaṇḍakaraṇamattenāti gomayaparibhaṇḍakasāvaparibhaṇḍakaraṇamattena, “Paribhaṇḍakaraṇamattena means merely doing paribhaṇḍa with cow dung or with a bitter substance.” Vmv 4.318: Kasāvaparibhaṇḍanti kasāvarasehi bhūmiparikammaṁ, “Paribhaṇḍa with a bitter substance means treating the floor with a bitter substance.”

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.18.eng: and they put monks in charge of building work for twenty years,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.21.eng: and they put monks in charge of building work for life on finished dwellings.
pli-tv-kd16:17.1.21.comm: Sp 4.323: Dhūmakālikanti idaṁ yāvassa citakadhūmo na paññāyati, tāva ayaṁ vihāro etassevāti evaṁ dhūmakāle apaloketvā katapariyositaṁ vihāraṁ denti, “Dhūmakālika: here, ‘As long as the smoke from the funeral pile is not seen, until then this dwelling is for this one’, in this way, looking for the time of the smoke, they give a dwelling that has been finished.”

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.22.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd16:17.1.22.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.23.pli: “kathañhi nāma āḷavakā bhikkhū evarūpāni navakammāni dassanti—
pli-tv-kd16:17.1.23.eng: “How can the monks at Āḷavī put monks in charge of such kinds of work?”

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.42.eng: “Is it true, monks, that they do this?”

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.45.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.46.eng: “You shouldn’t put monks in charge of building work such as this: the mere filling of gaps,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.49.eng: the mere making of door jambs,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.51.eng: the mere application of white coloring,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.52.eng: the mere application of black coloring,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.53.eng: the mere treatment with red ocher,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.54.eng: the mere covering with a roof,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.55.eng: the mere fastening of a roof,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.57.eng: the mere repair of what is defective or broken,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.58.eng: or the mere plastering of floors;

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.59.eng: and you shouldn’t put monks in charge of building work for twenty years,

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.62.pli: Na dhūmakālikampi pariyositaṃ vihāraṃ navakammaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd16:17.1.62.eng: or put monks in charge of building work for life on finished dwellings.

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.63.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd16:17.1.64.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, akataṃ vā vippakataṃ vā navakammaṃ dātuṃ, khuddake vihāre kammaṃ oloketvā chappañcavassikaṃ navakammaṃ dātuṃ, aḍḍhayoge kammaṃ oloketvā sattaṭṭhavassikaṃ navakammaṃ dātuṃ, mahallake vihāre pāsāde vā kammaṃ oloketvā dasadvādasavassikaṃ navakammaṃ dātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:17.1.64.eng: I allow you to put monks in charge of building work that isn’t yet started or that’s partially complete. For a small dwelling, you should inspect the work and then put a monk in charge of the building work for five or six years. For a small stilt house, you should inspect the work and then put a monk in charge of the building work for seven or eight years. For a large dwelling or stilt house, you should inspect the work and then put a monk in charge of the building work for ten or twelve years.”
pli-tv-kd16:17.1.64.comm: “A small stilt house” renders aḍḍhayoga. Vmv 3.73: Aḍḍhayogoti ekasālo dīghapāsādo, “An aḍḍhayoga is a long stilt house with a single room.” That the aḍḍhayoga is smaller than a regular pāsāda, which is the generic term for a “stilt house”, is also implied by the duration of the work that may be given.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū sabbe vihāre navakammaṃ denti.
pli-tv-kd16:17.2.1.eng: On one occasion the monks put one person in charge of the building work on all the dwellings.
pli-tv-kd16:17.2.1.comm: Vmv 4.323: Ekassa sabbesu vihāresu navakammaṁ detīti attho, “The meaning is they gave the building work on all the buildings to one person.”

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.3.eng: “You shouldn’t put one person in charge of the building work on all the dwellings.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū ekassa dve denti.
pli-tv-kd16:17.2.5.eng: On one occasion the monks put one person in charge of the building work on two dwellings.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.7.eng: “You shouldn’t put one person in charge of the building work on two dwellings.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.9.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū navakammaṃ gahetvā aññaṃ vāsenti.
pli-tv-kd16:17.2.9.eng: On one occasion the monks who had taken on building work had someone else stay in that dwelling.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.11.eng: “When you have taken on building work, you shouldn’t have someone else stay in that dwelling.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.12.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.13.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū navakammaṃ gahetvā saṅghikaṃ paṭibāhenti.
pli-tv-kd16:17.2.13.eng: At one time monks who had taken on building work reserved what belonged to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.15.eng: “When you have taken on building work, you shouldn’t reserve what belongs to the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.16.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.17.eng: I allow you to take one good bed.”

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.18.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū nissīme ṭhitassa navakammaṃ denti.
pli-tv-kd16:17.2.18.eng: On one occasion the monks put one who was outside the monastery zone in charge of building work.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.20.eng: “You shouldn’t put one who’s outside the monastery zone in charge of building work.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.21.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.22.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū navakammaṃ gahetvā sabbakālaṃ paṭibāhanti.
pli-tv-kd16:17.2.22.eng: At one time the monks who had taken on building work reserved a dwelling at all times.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.24.eng: “When you have taken on building work, you shouldn’t reserve a dwelling at all times.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.25.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.26.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, vassānaṃ temāsaṃ paṭibāhituṃ, utukālaṃ pana na paṭibāhitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:17.2.26.eng: I allow you to reserve it for the three months of the rainy-season residence, but not at other times.”

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū navakammaṃ gahetvā pakkamantipi, vibbhamantipi, kālampi karonti;
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.1.eng: At that time monks who had taken on building work left, disrobed, died,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.3.eng: admitted to having renounced the training,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.4.eng: admitted to having committed the worst kind of offense,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.7.eng: admitted to being overwhelmed by pain,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.8.eng: admitted to having been suspended for not recognizing an offense,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.9.eng: admitted to having been suspended for not making amends for an offense,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.10.eng: admitted to having been suspended for not giving up a bad view,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.11.eng: admitted to being a paṇḍaka,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.13.eng: admitted to previously having left to join the monastics of another religion,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.17.eng: admitted to being a murderer of a perfected one,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.18.eng: admitted to having raped a nun,
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.18.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “raped” for dūsita, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.19.eng: admitted to having caused a schism in the Sangha,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.20.eng: admitted to having caused the Buddha to bleed,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.21.eng: or admitted to being a hermaphrodite.

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.23.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu navakammaṃ gahetvā pakkamati—
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.23.eng: “If a monk who’s taken on building work departs,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.24.eng: it should be given to another, with the thought, ‘What belongs to the Sangha shouldn’t be allowed to deteriorate.’

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.25.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu navakammaṃ gahetvā vibbhamati …pe…
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.25.eng: If a monk who’s taken on building work disrobes,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.26.pli: kālaṃ karoti, sāmaṇero paṭijānāti, sikkhaṃ paccakkhātako paṭijānāti, antimavatthuṃ ajjhāpannako paṭijānāti, ummattako paṭijānāti, khittacitto paṭijānāti, vedanāṭṭo paṭijānāti, āpattiyā adassane ukkhittako paṭijānāti, āpattiyā appaṭikamme ukkhittako paṭijānāti, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhittako paṭijānāti, paṇḍako paṭijānāti, theyyasaṃvāsako paṭijānāti, titthiyapakkantako paṭijānāti, tiracchānagato paṭijānāti, mātughātako paṭijānāti, pitughātako paṭijānāti, arahantaghātako paṭijānāti, bhikkhunidūsako paṭijānāti, saṅghabhedako paṭijānāti, lohituppādako paṭijānāti, ubhatobyañjanako paṭijānāti—
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.26.eng: dies, admits to being a novice monk, admits to having renounced the training, admits to having committed the worst kind of offense, admits to being insane, admits to being deranged, admits to being overwhelmed by pain, admits to having been suspended for not recognizing an offense, admits to having been suspended for not making amends for an offense, admits to having been suspended for not giving up a bad view, admits to being a paṇḍaka, admits to being a fake monk, admits to previously having left to join the monastics of another religion, admits to being an animal, admits to being a matricide, admits to being a patricide, admits to being a murderer of a perfected one, admits to having raped a nun, admits to having caused a schism in the Sangha, admits to having caused the Buddha to bleed, or admits to being a hermaphrodite,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.27.eng: it should be given to another, with the thought, ‘What belongs to the Sangha shouldn’t be allowed to deteriorate.’

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.28.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu navakammaṃ gahetvā vippakate pakkamati—
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.28.eng: If a monk who’s taken on building work departs while it’s still unfinished,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.29.eng: it should be given to another, with the thought, ‘What belongs to the Sangha shouldn’t be allowed to deteriorate.’

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.30.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu navakammaṃ gahetvā vippakate vibbhamati …pe…
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.30.eng: If a monk who’s taken on building work disrobes while it’s still unfinished …

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.31.eng: or admits to being a hermaphrodite while it’s still unfinished,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.32.eng: it should be given to another, with the thought, ‘What belongs to the Sangha shouldn’t be allowed to deteriorate.’

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.33.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu navakammaṃ gahetvā pariyosite pakkamati—
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.33.eng: If a monk who’s taken on building work departs when it’s finished,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.34.comm: Sp 4.323: Pariyosite pakkamati tassevetanti puna āgantvā vasantassa antovassaṁ tasseva taṁ, “‘Departs when it is finished, then it is still his’ means: after returning, if he stays there, then within the rainy-season residence it is still his.”

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.35.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu navakammaṃ gahetvā pariyosite vibbhamati …pe…
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.35.eng: If a monk who’s taken on building work disrobes when it’s finished;

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.36.pli: kālaṃ karoti, sāmaṇero paṭijānāti, sikkhaṃ paccakkhātako paṭijānāti, antimavatthuṃ ajjhāpannako paṭijānāti—
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.36.eng: dies when it’s finished; admits, when it’s finished, to being a novice monk; admits, when it’s finished, to having renounced the training; or admits, when it’s finished, to having committed the worst kind of offense—

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.37.eng: then the Sangha is the owner.

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.38.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu navakammaṃ gahetvā pariyosite ummattako paṭijānāti, khittacitto paṭijānāti, vedanāṭṭo paṭijānāti, āpattiyā adassane ukkhittako paṭijānāti, āpattiyā appaṭikamme ukkhittako paṭijānāti, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhittako paṭijānāti—
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.38.eng: If a monk who’s taken on building work admits, when it’s finished, to being insane; admits, when it’s finished, to being deranged; admits, when it’s finished, to being overwhelmed by pain; admits, when it’s finished, to having been suspended for not recognizing an offense; admits, when it’s finished, to having been suspended for not making amends for an offense; or admits, when it’s finished, to having been suspended for not giving up a bad view—

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.40.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu navakammaṃ gahetvā pariyosite paṇḍako paṭijānāti, theyyasaṃvāsako paṭijānāti, titthiyapakkantako paṭijānāti, tiracchānagato paṭijānāti, mātughātako paṭijānāti, pitughātako paṭijānāti, arahantaghātako paṭijānāti, bhikkhunidūsako paṭijānāti, saṅghabhedako paṭijānāti, lohituppādako paṭijānāti, ubhatobyañjanako paṭijānāti—
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.40.eng: If a monk who’s taken on building work admits, when it’s finished, to being a paṇḍaka; admits, when it’s finished, to being a fake monk; admits, when it’s finished, to previously having left to join the monastics of another religion; admits, when it’s finished, to being an animal; admits, when it’s finished, to being a matricide; admits, when it’s finished, to being a patricide; admits, when it’s finished, to being a murderer of a perfected one; admits, when it’s finished, to having raped a nun; admits, when it’s finished, to having caused a schism in the Sangha; admits, when it’s finished, to having caused the Buddha to bleed; or admits, when it’s finished, to being a hermaphrodite—

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.41.eng: then the Sangha is the owner.”

pli-tv-kd16:18.1.0.eng: 22. The prohibition against using equipment where it doesn’t belong, etc.

pli-tv-kd16:18.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū aññatarassa upāsakassa vihāraparibhogaṃ senāsanaṃ aññatra paribhuñjanti.
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.1.eng: At one time the monks used a certain lay follower’s equipment where it did not belong.

pli-tv-kd16:18.1.2.pli: Atha kho so upāsako ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.2.eng: That lay follower complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd16:18.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhadantā aññatra paribhogaṃ aññatra paribhuñjissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.3.eng: “How can the venerables use the equipment where it doesn’t belong?”

pli-tv-kd16:18.1.5.eng: “You shouldn’t use equipment where it doesn’t belong.

pli-tv-kd16:18.1.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:18.1.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū uposathaggampi sannisajjampi harituṃ kukkuccāyantā chamāya nisīdanti.
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.7.eng: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not take any equipment to the observance-day hall or to meetings. They sat down on the bare ground,

pli-tv-kd16:18.1.8.eng: their limbs and robes becoming dirty.

pli-tv-kd16:18.1.11.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghassa mahāvihāro undriyati.
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.11.eng: At that time a large dwelling belonging to the Sangha was decaying.

pli-tv-kd16:18.1.12.eng: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not remove the furniture.

pli-tv-kd16:18.1.14.eng: “I allow you to move it for the purpose of protection.”

pli-tv-kd16:19.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghassa senāsanaparikkhāriko mahaggho kambalo uppanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.1.eng: On one occasion the Sangha had been given a valuable, woolen furniture cloth.
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.1.comm: It can be seen from Bi NP 11:1.1 that valuable, woolen cloth, mahaggha kambala, was considered inappropriate for monastics.

pli-tv-kd16:19.1.3.eng: “I allow you to do a beneficial trade.”
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.3.comm: Sp 4.324: Phātikammatthāyāti vaḍḍhikammatthāya. Phātikammañcettha samakaṁ vā atirekaṁ vā agghanakaṁ mañcapīṭhādisenāsanameva vaṭṭati, “Phātikammatthāya means for the purpose of making a profit. Here, doing a beneficial (trade) with furniture, such as a bed or bench, etc., equal or greater in value, is allowed.”

pli-tv-kd16:19.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghassa senāsanaparikkhārikaṃ mahagghaṃ dussaṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.4.eng: On one occasion the Sangha was offered a valuable furniture cloth.

pli-tv-kd16:19.1.6.eng: “I allow you to do a beneficial trade.”

pli-tv-kd16:19.1.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghassa acchacammaṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.7.eng: On one occasion the Sangha was offered a bear skin.

pli-tv-kd16:19.1.9.eng: “I allow you to make it into a doormat.”

pli-tv-kd16:19.1.10.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghassa cakkalikaṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.10.eng: On one occasion the Sangha was offered a round pad.
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.10.comm: Sp 4.324: Cakkalikanti kambalādīhi veṭhetvā katacakkalikaṁ, “Cakkalika means a cakkalika made by wrapping with woolen cloth, etc.” Sp-ṭ 4.324: Cakkalikanti kambalādīhi veṭhetvā cakkasaṇṭhānena pādapuñchanayoggaṁ kataṁ, “Cakkalika means after wrapping with woolen cloth, etc., having the shape of a wheel, it is made suitable as a doormat.”

pli-tv-kd16:19.1.12.eng: “I allow you to make it into a doormat.”

pli-tv-kd16:19.1.13.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghassa coḷakaṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.13.eng: On one occasion the Sangha was offered a cloth.

pli-tv-kd16:19.1.15.eng: “I allow you to make it into a doormat.”

pli-tv-kd16:20.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū adhotehi pādehi senāsanaṃ akkamanti.
pli-tv-kd16:20.1.1.eng: At that time there were monks who stepped into the dwellings with dirty feet.

pli-tv-kd16:20.1.4.eng: “You shouldn’t step into a dwelling with dirty feet.

pli-tv-kd16:20.1.5.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:20.1.6.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū allehi pādehi senāsanaṃ akkamanti.
pli-tv-kd16:20.1.6.eng: At that time there were monks who stepped into the dwellings with wet feet.

pli-tv-kd16:20.1.9.eng: “You shouldn’t step into a dwelling with wet feet.

pli-tv-kd16:20.1.10.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:20.1.11.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū saupāhanā senāsanaṃ akkamanti.
pli-tv-kd16:20.1.11.eng: At that time there were monks who stepped into the dwellings with their sandals on.

pli-tv-kd16:20.1.14.eng: “You shouldn’t step into a dwelling with your sandals on.

pli-tv-kd16:20.1.15.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd16:20.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū parikammakatāya bhūmiyā niṭṭhubhanti.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.1.eng: At that time there were monks who spat on treated floors.

pli-tv-kd16:20.2.5.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd16:20.2.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena mañcapādāpi pīṭhapādāpi parikammakataṃ bhūmiṃ vilikhanti.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.7.eng: At that time the legs of the beds and benches scratched the treated floors. The coloring was spoiled.

pli-tv-kd16:20.2.9.eng: “You should wrap the legs in cloth.”

pli-tv-kd16:20.2.10.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū parikammakataṃ bhittiṃ apassenti.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.10.eng: At that time there were monks who leaned on treated walls.

pli-tv-kd16:20.2.14.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd16:20.2.16.pli: Apassenaphalakaṃ heṭṭhato bhūmiṃ vilikhati, uparito bhittiñca.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.16.eng: The lower edge of the leaning boards scratched the floor and the upper edge scratched the wall.

pli-tv-kd16:20.2.18.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, heṭṭhato ca uparito ca coḷakena paliveṭhetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.18.eng: “You should wrap the lower and upper edges in cloth.”

pli-tv-kd16:20.2.19.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū dhotapādakā nipajjituṃ kukkuccāyanti.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.19.eng: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not lie down with washed feet.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.19.comm: Presumably because their feet were still wet.

pli-tv-kd16:20.2.21.eng: “You should spread a sheet and then lie down.”

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.0.eng: 23. The allowance for meals for the Sangha, etc.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āḷaviyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena rājagahaṃ tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Āḷavī for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena rājagahaṃ tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.3.eng: he stayed in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahaṃ dubbhikkhaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.4.eng: At that time Rājagaha was short of food

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.5.eng: and people were unable to make meals for the whole Sangha.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.5.comm: “Whole” is supplied from the commentary at Sp 4.325.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.6.pli: icchanti uddesabhattaṃ nimantanaṃ salākabhattaṃ pakkhikaṃ uposathikaṃ pāṭipadikaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.6.eng: Instead they wished to make meals for designated monks, invitational meals, meals for which lots are drawn, half-monthly meals, meals on the observance day, and meals on the day after the observance day.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.8.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, saṅghabhattaṃ uddesabhattaṃ nimantanaṃ salākabhattaṃ pakkhikaṃ uposathikaṃ pāṭipadikan”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.8.eng: “I allow meals for the Sangha, meals for designated monks, invitational meals, meals for which lots are drawn, half-monthly meals, meals on the observance days, and meals on the days after the observance day.”

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.9.0.eng: 24. The appointment of a designator of meals

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.9.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū attano varabhattāni gahetvā lāmakāni bhattāni bhikkhūnaṃ denti.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.9.1.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six took the best meals for themselves and gave the inferior ones to the other monks.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.11.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgataṃ bhikkhuṃ bhattuddesakaṃ sammannituṃ—
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.11.eng: “You should appoint a monk who has five qualities as the designator of meals:

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.12.pli: yo na chandāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na dosāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na mohāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na bhayāgatiṃ gaccheyya, uddiṭṭhānuddiṭṭhañca jāneyya.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.12.eng: he’s not biased by favoritism, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he knows what has and has not been designated.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.13.eng: And he should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.14.pli: Paṭhamaṃ bhikkhu yācitabbo, yācitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.14.eng: First a monk should be asked, and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.15.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.16.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ bhattuddesakaṃ sammanneyya.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.16.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint monk so-and-so as designator of meals.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.18.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.19.eng: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as designator of meals.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.20.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno bhattuddesakassa sammuti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.20.eng: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so as designator of meals should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.21.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.22.eng: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so as designator of meals.

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.23.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.23.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.24.eng: The monks who were designator of meals thought,

pli-tv-kd16:21.1.27.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, salākāya vā paṭṭikāya vā upanibandhitvā opuñjitvā bhattaṃ uddisitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.27.eng: “You should mark tickets, make a heap of them, and then designate the meals.”
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.27.comm: Sp 4.325: Rukkhasāramayāya salākāya vā veḷuvilīvatālapaṇṇādimayāya paṭṭikāya vā “asukassa nāma salākabhattan”ti evaṁ akkharāni upanibandhitvā pacchiyaṁ vā cīvarabhoge vā katvā sabbā salākāyo opuñjitvā punappunaṁ heṭṭhuparivaseneva āloḷetvā pañcaṅgasamannāgatena bhattuddesakena sace ṭhitikā atthi, ṭhitikato paṭṭhāya; no ce atthi, therāsanato paṭṭhāya salākā dātabbā, “Having marked with letters a (salākā)-ticket made of heartwood or (paṭṭikā)-ticket made of bamboo or palm leaves, (showing), ‘This is the meal drawn by lots of so-and-so’, having placed it in a basket or the fold of a robe, having collected all the tickets, having mixed them again and again from below and above, the distributor of meals who has five qualities should give tickets according to a schedule, if there is one, or according to seniority if there is not.” The point, presumably, is that the donors’ names that have been drawn are distributed according to seniority.

pli-tv-kd16:21.2.0.eng: 25. The appointment of an assigner of dwellings, etc.

pli-tv-kd16:21.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghassa senāsanapaññāpako na hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd16:21.2.1.eng: At that time there was no assigner of dwellings …

pli-tv-kd16:21.2.3.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “robe-cloth” for cīvara, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd16:21.2.8.eng: Because it was not distributed, the fresh food perished.

pli-tv-kd16:21.2.10.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgataṃ bhikkhuṃ khajjakabhājakaṃ sammannituṃ—
pli-tv-kd16:21.2.10.eng: “You should appoint a monk who has five qualities as the distributor of fresh food:

pli-tv-kd16:21.2.11.pli: yo na chandāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na dosāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na mohāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na bhayāgatiṃ gaccheyya, bhājitābhājitañca jāneyya.
pli-tv-kd16:21.2.11.eng: he’s not biased by favoritism, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he knows what has and has not been distributed.

pli-tv-kd16:21.2.12.eng: And he should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-kd16:21.2.13.pli: Paṭhamaṃ bhikkhu yācitabbo, yācitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.0.eng: 26. The appointment of a distributor of minor requisites

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghassa bhaṇḍāgāre appamattako parikkhāro uppanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.1.eng: At that time there were minor requisites in the storeroom.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.1.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “requisites” for parikkhāra, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.3.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgataṃ bhikkhuṃ appamattakavissajjakaṃ sammannituṃ—
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.3.eng: “You should appoint a monk who has five qualities as the distributor of minor requisites:

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.4.pli: yo na chandāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na dosāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na mohāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na bhayāgatiṃ gaccheyya, vissajjitāvissajjitañca jāneyya.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.4.eng: he’s not biased by favoritism, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he knows what has and has not been distributed.

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.5.eng: And he should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.10.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.16.pli: Tena appamattakavissajjakena bhikkhunā ekā sūci dātabbā, satthakaṃ dātabbaṃ, upāhanā dātabbā, kāyabandhanaṃ dātabbaṃ, aṃsabaddhako dātabbo, parissāvanaṃ dātabbaṃ, dhammakaraṇo dātabbo, kusi dātabbā, aḍḍhakusi dātabbā, maṇḍalaṃ dātabbaṃ, aḍḍhamaṇḍalaṃ dātabbaṃ, anuvāto dātabbo, paribhaṇḍaṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.16.eng: The monk who is the distributor of minor requisites should give things out one by one: needles, knives, sandals, belts, shoulder straps, water filters, and water strainers, and also robe material for long inter-panel strips, for short inter-panel strips, for large panels, for medium-sized panels, for lengthwise borders, and for crosswise borders.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.16.comm: The last six terms are explained in the commentaries as follows. Vin-vn-ṭ 563: Kusinti āyāmato ca vitthārato ca anuvātaṁ cīvaramajjhe tādisameva dīghapattañca, “A kusi is a long panel that is a lengthwise or crosswise border in the middle of the robe.” Vin-vn-ṭ 563: Aḍḍhakusinti anuvātasadisaṁ cīvaramajjhe tattha tattha rassapattaṁ, “An aḍḍhakusi is a short panel like a border, here and there in the middle of the robe.” Sp 3.245: Maṇḍalanti pañcakhaṇḍikacīvarassa ekekasmiṁ khaṇḍe mahāmaṇḍalaṁ, “A maṇḍala is the large panel in each section of a robe with five sections.” The aḍḍhamaṇḍala is explained in connection with comments on the vivaṭṭa, “the middle section”. Vin-vn-ṭ 563: Vivaṭṭanti maṇḍalaṁ, aḍḍhamaṇḍalañcāti dve ekato katvā sibbitaṁ vemajjhe khaṇḍaṁ, “The vivaṭṭa is the section in the middle, which is made by sewing together a large panel (maṇḍala) and a medium-sized panel (aḍḍhamaṇḍala).” The vivaṭṭa, “section in the middle”, is one of usually five main sections of the robe; see just below. Anuvāta is explained in connection with making the kathina robe in the commentary to the Kathinakkhandhaka, the Chapter on the Robe-making Ceremony. Sp 3.308: Anuvātakaraṇamattenāti piṭṭhianuvātāropanamattena, “Anuvātakaraṇamattena means merely by mounting a border at the back.” Which is further explained at Sp-ṭ 3.308: Piṭṭhianuvātāropanamattenāti dīghato anuvātassa āropanamattena, “Piṭṭhianuvātāropanamattena means merely by mounting a border lengthwise.” Paribhaṇḍa is also explained in connection with making the kathina robe in the commentary to the Kathinakkhandhaka. Sp 3.308: Paribhaṇḍakaraṇamattenāti kucchianauvātāropanamattena, “Paribhaṇḍakaraṇamattena means merely by mounting a border at the belly.” Which is further explained at Sp-ṭ 3.308: Kucchianuvātāropanamattenāti puthulato anuvātassa āropanamattena, “Kucchianuvātāropanamattena means merely by adding a border crosswise.”

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.17.pli: Sace hoti saṅghassa sappi vā telaṃ vā madhu vā phāṇitaṃ vā, sakiṃ paṭisāyituṃ dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.17.eng: If the Sangha has ghee, oil, honey, or syrup, he should give it out for a single use.

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.18.pli: Sace punapi attho hoti, punapi dātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.18.eng: If it is needed again, he should give it out again.

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.19.1.eng: At that time there was no distributor of rainy-season bathing cloths …
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.19.1.comm: Commenting on Bu Pc 79, Kkh-pṭ says: Sāṭiyaggāhāpakoti vassikasāṭiyaggāhāpako, “Sāṭiyaggāhāpaka means a distributor of rainy-season bathing cloths.”

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.21.comm: The typical translation of ārāmika, found both in the CPD and DOP, is “monastery attendant” or “monastery servant”. Yet, perhaps the only place in the Canonical texts where the meaning of the word is clear from the context, Bu NP 23:1.1.5, it means “monastery worker”.
